speaker: MULDER (V.O.)
line: Before the exploration of space, of the moon and the planets, man hailed that the heavens were the home and province of powerful gods who controlled not just the vast firmament, but the earthly fate of man himself and that the pantheon of powerful, warring deities, was the cause and reason for the human condition, for the past and the future, and for which great monuments would be created on earth as in heaven. But in time man replaced these gods with new gods and new religions that provided no more certain or greater answers than those worshipped by his Greek or Roman or Egyptian ancestors. And while we've chosen now our monolithic and benevolent gods and found our certainties in science, believers all, we wait for a sign, a revelation. Our eyes turn skyward ready to accept the truly incredible to find our destiny written in the stars. But how do we best look to see? With new eyes or old?

speaker: FRIEND
line: <They're here.>

speaker: DMITRI
line: <Do you think the others have seen them?>

speaker: FRIEND
line: <Let's go tell them.>

speaker: FRIEND
line: <Do you smell that?>

speaker: DMITRI
line: <Fire.>

speaker: FRIEND
line: Mama! Papa!

speaker: DMITRI
line: Papa!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <What is your name?>

speaker: DMITRI
line: <Dmitri.>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <You saw what happened here?>

speaker: DMITRI
line: <Yes.>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Too bad for you.

speaker: SOLDIER
line: It's like the flesh is cooked... all the way through.

speaker: KRYCEK (O.S.)
line: <You there. Under what authority are you corrupting this crime scene?>

speaker: MARITA
line: <Under the United Nations Charter, chapter 7, articles 39 and 42...>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Your authority isn't recognized here. Only your lies.

speaker: MARITA
line: These are UN Peacekeepers. This is a mission of mercy.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: This is a mission of fear. Yours and the men you work for.

speaker: MARITA
line: I don't know what you're talking about.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You go back and you tell them what you've seen here, what you've found.

speaker: MARITA
line: My name is Marita Covarrubias. I am a Special Representative to the Secretary General of the United Nations.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I know who you are, and I know who you work for. Now you go back and you tell them...

speaker: MARITA
line: Tell them what? What happened here?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Tell them it's all going to Hell.

speaker: MARITA
line: Does the boy know?

speaker: MARITA
line: Did he see?!

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You tell them to kiss my American ass.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: During my last several abductions I have experienced no fear whatsoever. And it was the absence of fear that allowed me to communicate with them and them with me. They've told me that I am an apostle, here to spread the word of the dawning of a new age of supernatural enlightenment.

speaker: LAGERQVIST
line: Wonderful, just wonderful!

speaker: LAGERQVIST
line: Sensibly, it's not a question of truth versus fiction, but of truths which are incomprehensible, because we have no physics - no real language for explaining Patient "X"'s story, much less the existence of extraterrestrials - nothing to prepare us for the ontological shock that is bound to follow...

speaker: WOMAN
line: We quibble and we jaw about the need for proof for evidence as if it would serve some purpose, as if it would make a difference, when what we are here but WHY and what their business is.

speaker: FAZIO
line: In my conversations with her, she believes this business - the abductions and the experiments - are due to their plans for us, and that we are not simply breeding cows for them, as some have suggested - but subjects, much like we think of our relationship with God. And that there are sites - what she calls lighthouses - around which will be great activity.

speaker: MULDER
line: All this conjecture - the "ontological shock" that you speak of, for which we are so ill-equipped - is not only false but dangerous. This woman... this woman presents no good or credible testimony apart from the feel-good message that she promotes.

speaker: FAZIO
line: You think she's lying?

speaker: MULDER
line: No, I don't think she's lying. I think that if you prepare people well enough to believe a lie, they will believe it as if it were true. And if you tell them a really big lie, like there are aliens from outer space, much more than a small one, they will believe in it. And if you suggest to them these aliens are doing bad things to them, the... the power of the suggestion will be to make people believe that certain psychopathologies and neuroses that they're suffering from can now be attributed to that.

speaker: LAGERQVIST
line: Mr. Mulder... Agent Mulder, she has physical ailments.

speaker: WOMAN
line: Are you discounting any belief in the existence of extraterrestrials?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I just question mindless belief.

speaker: FAZIO
line: But you've cited evidence. You've made claims yourself.

speaker: MULDER
line: What I've seen, I've seen because I wanted to believe. I... if you look too hard, you can go mad, but if you continue to look, you become liberated. And you become awake, as if from a dream, realizing that... which knows its greatest strength is not in defense, but in attack. It's strongly held by believers in UFO phenomena that there is military complicity or involvement in abductions, but what if there is no complicity? What if there is simply just the military, seeking to develop an arsenal against which there ass out of the nation with stories of little green men - a conspiracy wrapped in a plot inside a government agenda.

speaker: MULDER
line: Dr. Werber?

speaker: WERBER
line: It's been some time.

speaker: MULDER
line: Almost five years.

speaker: WERBER
line: I came down expecting to hear how your work had progressed. I'm... surprised, to say the least.

speaker: MULDER
line: A lot has changed.

speaker: WERBER
line: You seem to have abandoned something you believed so completely. In spite of what I know about you from our work together - the memories I helped you recover about the experience with your sister.

speaker: MULDER
line: Well, I've come to distrust a lot of things. I've - I've come to distrust those memories.

speaker: WERBER
line: I'm sorry.

speaker: MULDER
line: For what?

speaker: WERBER
line: I've taken a lot of criticism for my work with alien abductees, and in the field itself. The regression hypnosis work I did with you...

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not questioning your methods, Dr. Werber. I'm questioning myself, and how I was tricked, how I was led to believe through an elaborate staging of events that my sister had been abducted.

speaker: WERBER
line: A man with faith can indulge in the luxury of skepticism.

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't think you understand. There's just too much evidence that it's all been a lie. The conspiracy is not to hide the existence of extraterrestrials. It's to make people believe in it so completely that they question nothing.

speaker: WERBER
line: So, you and I have just been advocates of insanity all along? Is this the extreme possibility you believe in now?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah. Is Patient "X" any more credible?

speaker: WERBER
line: I hope so. I'm her doctor. I think you should meet her. I think you might change your mind.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <The boy has told me what I need to know. You may begin.>

speaker: DOCTOR
line: <But he is just a boy. We do our experiments only on the criminal.>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <Do you argue with me?>

speaker: DOCTOR
line: <I have orders.>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <And now you have new orders.>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <You were never here.>

speaker: DMITRI
line: <Are you going to kill me?>

speaker: DOCTOR
line: <No.>

speaker: DMITRI
line: <Why not?>

speaker: DOCTOR
line: <We are doing a test.>

speaker: WERBER
line: Cassandra?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Hi.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Fox Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Hi.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: I... I am so glad to finally meet you. You are hero of mine.

speaker: MULDER
line: I am?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: I read about you in the news, about three years ago. How you helped that man who escaped from the hospital - um, Duane Barry. How he had held those people hostage at the travel agency, because he was being called by aliens, and... and you were the only one who believed him.

speaker: MULDER
line: You may not like me as much as you like that story.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Oh, that story saved my life.

speaker: MULDER
line: How's that?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: I have been a multiple abductee for over thirty years. I had been afraid to seek help. Nobody would ever believe me, really, until I read about you. That's how I came to meet Dr. Werber.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cassandra...

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: He told me that you had been through hypnotic regression yourself. That's how you discovered that your sister had been abducted.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cassandra?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Yes?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you here voluntarily?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Um... yes, under doctor's supervision.

speaker: MULDER
line: Whatever it is that you're afraid of, I suggest that you check yourself out of here as soon as you can and start living your life. Okay?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Uh, now is not a real good time.

speaker: WERBER
line: Cassandra is experiencing the sensation that she's about to be called.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Now is a time of war and stress among the alien nations. The... the different races - they're in upheaval. I will be summoned to a place, just like Duane Barry.

speaker: MULDER
line: The man you're talking about died because of what he believed in. He died in a room after I'd been interrogating him - after he received a visit from some men from our government.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: I'm sure the government's involved. They just, they don't want us to know about it all.

speaker: MULDER
line: Cassandra... there was a time when I would've believed what you're saying without a doubt.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: There is no doubt, Mr. Mulder. I know what I've experienced. I... I have been through the terror and the tests more times than I can count. I have had an unborn fetus taken from me. But they're not here for the reasons that you might think. They're here to deliver a message. Except... something has gone wrong. There are... there are other forces at work. They're going to be calling me. I can feel it. And you, of all people, need to know about this because you're the one that can do something.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm not.

speaker: BALD MAN
line: <Why was I not informed of this?>

speaker: AIDE
line: <Krycek was given orders.>

speaker: BALD MAN
line: <Where was the boy captured?>

speaker: AIDE
line: <I was told there was a site. People were burned alive.>

speaker: BALD MAN
line: <What did the boy say about this?>

speaker: AIDE
line: <I don't know. Only Krycek knows. He interrogated him - beat him. Then he ordered the test.>

speaker: BALD MAN
line: <What is this? Who has done this?>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: <I've brought you water. Can you hear me? If you can hear me, I need you to nod your head.>

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm going to take good care of you.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Agent Scully, my name is Jeffrey Spender. Special Agent Spender.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is there something I can help you with, Agent Spender?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I feel kind of funny approaching you like this. I just haven't been able to reach Agent Mulder.

speaker: SCULLY
line: About what?

speaker: SPENDER
line: About somebody he's been talking to... somebody who claims to be an alien abductee, who I'd really prefer he weren't talking to.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You're going to tell me who this is?

speaker: SPENDER
line: This is going to sound weird. Uh, it's my mother.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your mother?

speaker: SPENDER
line: It's a very long story. Uh... she's an exceptional person. But for reasons that are probably kind of obvious I'd rather this didn't get out. Appearances being what they are.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Is this part of a case?

speaker: SPENDER
line: No.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Then why is he talking to her?

speaker: SPENDER
line: I don't know. She just called me, and she's... she's a very disturbed woman. This is something that caused a lot of pain about twenty years ago. I'm just trying to save myself any extra humiliation. I'd like to build a reputation here, not be given one.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I think I understand.

speaker: MARITA
line: Whatever happened in Kazakhstan... there was no one left to give an accurate account.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: How many bodies were there?

speaker: MARITA
line: Forty-one... all burned beyond recognition. The result of some kind of intense biochemical reaction, none of the UN Medics had ever seen. Not in the Gulf or on any battlefield. The corpses were literally carbonized from the heat.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: A new weapon being tested?

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: There's no intelligence on that.

speaker: MARITA
line: There's no clear data on the victims or their relationship, but I found at least two of these among the dead.

speaker: WMM
line: I think it's fairly certain that all the victims had them. That what was taking place was a staging for a group abduction.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: What the hell is that?

speaker: WMM
line: In the final phases before it begins, there will most likely be assemblies.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: We're years away from that.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: If we're to believe their timetable.

speaker: WMM
line: Unless it's already begun.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: We're fifteen years away!

speaker: MARITA
line: I don't think this was planned. I think something - or someone - set this in motion. An act of war. Against us and our plans. Krycek was at the burn site with a unit of Russian soldiers.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: Alex Krycek did this?

speaker: MARITA
line: He was there, probably acting on the same data we got. Whether he had any direct involvement in what happened, he knows what caused it.

speaker: WMM
line: Knows, how?

speaker: MARITA
line: He captured a boy at the site. A survivor. Someone who saw.

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: What does Krycek want?

speaker: MARITA
line: I don't know.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: How do we find out?

speaker: WMM
line: Yes?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Well, look who's answering the bat-phone.

speaker: WMM
line: Alex Krycek.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Those guys too cheap to offer you a pension plan?

speaker: WMM
line: Where are you?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'm in town, actually. New York City.

speaker: WMM
line: Just tell us what you want.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: You've been working on a vaccine. Against the black oil.

speaker: WMM
line: Unsuccessfully, you know.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah, well. I figured you and your buddies must have been busy while I've been gone.

speaker: WMM
line: Our research continues.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: I'll take everything you've got.

speaker: WMM
line: In exchange for?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: The boy.

speaker: WMM
line: Why is that in our interest?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Because without what he knows, you're not going to need any vaccine.

speaker: WMM
line: What does he know?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: That's my opening offer. The longer you wait, the skinnier this kid gets.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Shouldn't that be my picture next to the headline?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Or is that just you having a little fun?

speaker: MULDER
line: Do I look like I'm having fun, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: You look constipated, actually.

speaker: MULDER
line: That makes sense. I've had my head up my rear end for the last five years.

speaker: SCULLY
line: This wouldn't have anything to do with Cassandra Spender?

speaker: MULDER
line: Cassandra Spender is living proof that the truth I've so boldly sought for the last five years is the truth of a madman.

speaker: SCULLY
line: How's that?

speaker: MULDER
line: One more anal-probing, gyro-pyro levitating-ecoplasm alien anti-matter story, and I'm gonna take out my gun and shoot somebody.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well... I guess I'm done here. You seem to have invalidated your own work. Have a nice life.

speaker: MULDER
line: How do you know about Cassandra Spender?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Her son accosted me in the hallway. He's an FBI agent.

speaker: MULDER
line: Great.

speaker: SCULLY
line: He's of the same opinion as you, by the way - that she's not well.

speaker: MULDER
line: You know, you try to reveal what's hidden, you try to incite people with the facts, but they'd rather believe some insane nonsense, refusing to believe what our government is capable of.

speaker: SCULLY
line: You've come a long way, Mulder.

speaker: MULDER
line: Yeah, and still nobody believes me.

speaker: MULDER
line: What?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cassandra Spender was abducted at Skyland Mountain. That's where I was taken... where Duane Barry took me.

speaker: MULDER
line: The woman is a nut, Scully.

speaker: SCULLY
line: It says here that she has an implant... in the base of her neck.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where the government no doubt removed her brain. Isn't that what her son stopped you to say, Scully?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Oh, no, he, uh, he asked if you'd please not talk about this with anyone.

speaker: MULDER
line: Wish granted.

speaker: DRIVER
line: Hi. I'm, uh, looking for... I'm looking for, uh...

speaker: TOLL COLLECTOR
line: You're looking for what?

speaker: DRIVER
line: A mountain, I think.

speaker: TOLL COLLECTOR
line: You and everybody else.

speaker: DRIVER
line: How's that?

speaker: TOLL COLLECTOR
line: Well, you're a little late to the party. Six dollars. I hope you find some parking.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cassandra? Miss Spender?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Oh. Yes? Do I know you? Of course I do.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I don't think so.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: No. No, I'm - I'm sure of it. Are you a doctor?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Uh, yes, but not a practising one.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: No?

speaker: SCULLY
line: My name is Dana Scully and, uh, I'd like to ask you some questions.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Questions about what?

speaker: SCULLY
line: May I? Um... I think you should know that I, uh... I learned about you from your son.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Jeffrey?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Yes. I'm an FBI agent and he asked that I protect against your story getting out.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Oh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I guess I'm betraying that by coming here. But, um... but I - I don't... I'm here for more personal reasons, actually. I took the liberty of reading your medical file.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: You're feeling it, too, aren't you?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Here. You wake up at night knowing you need to be somewhere, but you don't know where it is. Like you forgot an appointment you didn't know you had.

speaker: SCULLY
line: That's not why I'm here.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: Oh.

speaker: SCULLY
line: I'm here because I, uh... because... I wanted to tell you that you should... that you should not remove the thing that you have in your neck. Not without possible consequences. Um... I became very ill.

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: I'd never dream of removing it. I want to go... wherever it is. Oh, they have... so much to teach us. You being a doctor would want to know their great healers. Maybe that's why you were chosen.

speaker: DRIVER
line: Oh, my God.

speaker: BURNING MAN
line: Help me! Help me! Help me! Please! Help me!

speaker: MULDER
line: Are there any survivors?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No. Not as of this moment.

speaker: MULDER
line: From the smell...

speaker: SCULLY
line: They've all been burned and there are plenty more who are still being bagged as we speak.

speaker: MULDER
line: Any preliminary theories?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, it appears they all came by car. Most of the dead are congregated in a wooded area a short distance off the road.

speaker: MULDER
line: Self-immolation?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no evidence of that right now. There's no accelerants, no incindiary device.

speaker: MULDER
line: And what was their relationship to each other? Were they families?

speaker: SCULLY
line: There's no way to ID their bodies right now. It's going to be a painstaking dental process. Mulder, why are you tiptoeing around the obvious fact here? I mean, this is Skyland Mountain. We're right back here on Skyland Mountain.

speaker: MULDER
line: And you think it's related to your abduction from the same place?

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, you can't deny the connection.

speaker: MULDER
line: You think this is some kind of abduction scenario?

speaker: SCULLY
line: No... I'm not saying that.

speaker: MULDER
line: Do you have any evidence of that?

speaker: SCULLY
line: What do you mean by evidence?

speaker: MULDER
line: That's what I'm asking you.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Well, are you going to give me your theory, then?

speaker: MULDER
line: No. I'm going to give you an explanation.

speaker: MARITA
line: This is the same scene we saw in Kazakhstan.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: What the hell is going on? This is our own backyard...

speaker: FIRST ELDER
line: This is no good. I don't like being kept in the dark on this.

speaker: WMM
line: Someone's going to great lengths to sabotage our work.

speaker: SECOND ELDER
line: Who?

speaker: WMM
line: One way or another, we'd better find out before it's determined we're unable to handle this ourselves... to put a stop to it... before the Colonists intervene. Quiet Willy gets up and leaves.

speaker: NEWSREADER
line: More on our top story this hour - in the northern part of the state, last night's mass death in the forest just inside the national park at Skyland Mountain. Again, authorities have now released a barely-complete list of the deaths gathered from vehicle registrations, hoping relatives and friends will come forward and help to explain the cause or reasons of this bizarre tragedy. DAVE BROWNLEE MITCH LA FLEUR WAYNE POWER BOB BUXTON MARTY LACROIX WILLIAM UNRAU ANDREW SCULTHROP CHRIS FLEMINGTON PETER HUFF MARTY GROHN MALCOLM JOHNSON NIGEL HABGOOD BRUCE McLEOD KARL OJAMAE VAL ARNTZEN JAMES PATE KATHLEEN KASINGER GALE IRVINE INA BROOKS DON McGILL

speaker: SCULLY
line: Cassandra? You called us?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: This is not supposed to be happening. I knew these people.

speaker: MULDER
line: You knew them?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: They - they were friends of mine.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Friends from where?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: From a long time ago. It's not supposed to be happening. Not like this. You have to do something about it.

speaker: MULDER
line: What would you like me to do?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: You have to stop it.

speaker: MULDER
line: Stop who?

speaker: CASSANDRA
line: I don't know.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Agent Mulder? My name's Jeffrey Spender.

speaker: MULDER
line: Oh, son of... the prophet.

speaker: SPENDER
line: I asked you to leave her alone.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Your mother called us about the incident in Virginia. She said that she knew some of the dead.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Of course she did. They were in the same ridiculous cult that she used to be.

speaker: MULDER
line: There you have it.

speaker: SCULLY
line: She was in a cult?

speaker: SPENDER
line: A UFO cult believed they were going to be carried to immortality in some kind of flying motherwheel.

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm sorry. We won't be bothering you or your mother anymore.

speaker: MARITA
line: You think you can pull this off, don't you?

speaker: KRYCEK
line: They give me what I want... I'm going to rule the world.

speaker: MARITA
line: We've got them on their knees, Alex.

speaker: KRYCEK
line: Yeah?

speaker: MARITA
line: Let's get out of this hole.

speaker: WMM
line: Well?

speaker: WMM
line: Where's the boy?

speaker: MULDER
line: Are you ready for this? I've been going over the initial forensics and pathology reports from the incident at Skyland Mountain and, while the event itself remains unexplained, I think it's less than a mystery who's involved - at least for me, and certainly for you. Our pathologists here haven't finalized their reports, but I was able to have three victims selected at random for x-rays.

speaker: MULDER
line: That's how I found these - small pieces of what looks like metal in the charred cervical tissue here... here... and here. Implants.

speaker: MULDER
line: I followed up with the families of the three victims and I found that none had any cult associations but two out of the three belong to the local mutual UFO networks, and both of them claimed abduction experiences, and both of them were being treated by a medical health practitioner over the past few months.

speaker: SCULLY
line: For what?

speaker: MULDER
line: Take a look.

speaker: SCULLY
line: "Major depressive disorder characterized by periods of sustained anxiety and paranoia. Patient believes he will be contacted or called to an undisclosed place where he will be abducted by aliens."

speaker: MULDER
line: The implants triggered those responses. Those people were led to Skyland Mountain.

speaker: SCULLY
line: By whom?

speaker: MULDER
line: By the same government that put the implant in you, to function as a homing mechanism.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Mulder, that doesn't make sense.

speaker: MULDER
line: Why not? A tracking system using military app satellite technology to monitor test subjects. Or to stage what people might otherwise believe are alien abductions.

speaker: SCULLY
line: But they weren't abducted. They were led to their deaths. And for what purpose?

speaker: MULDER
line: I don't know that yet.

speaker: SCULLY
line: Now, Mulder...

speaker: SCULLY
line: Maybe you shouldn't be so quick to rule out what Cassandra Spender has to say.

speaker: MULDER
line: Mulder.

speaker: MARITA
line: Agent Mulder?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes?

speaker: MARITA
line: This is Marita Covarrubias. Is this a secure line we're on?

speaker: MULDER
line: Yes.

speaker: MARITA
line: You were at Skyland Mountain. Are you aware of a UN report on a similar incident in the former Soviet Union?

speaker: MULDER
line: No.

speaker: MARITA
line: I was in Kazakhstan, Agent Mulder. There is a connection. I have someone who knows it. I have him with me now.

speaker: MULDER
line: Where are you?

speaker: MARITA
line: At a pay phone on Skodal Road, just off the I-90. Come here and wait for my call for my call, for directions.

speaker: MULDER
line: Marita? Mar...

speaker: SPENDER
line: Hello?

speaker: MULDER
line: Who's this?

speaker: SPENDER
line: This is Special Agent Spender. Who's this?

speaker: MULDER
line: This is Fox Mulder.

speaker: SPENDER
line: Why are you calling here?

speaker: MULDER
line: I'm actually looking for Agent Scully. I haven't been able to reach her, and she said that -

speaker: SPENDER
line: She's not here. Nor is my mother.

speaker: MULDER
line: What are you talking about?

speaker: SPENDER
line: She's gone from her room.

speaker: MULDER
line: Gone where?

speaker: SPENDER
line: Look, she's just gone. Don't you get it? She's got nowhere to go.

speaker: AMAZED WOMAN
line: Look!

speaker: STUNNED MAN
line: There! There it is!
